qas.question: What is Penicillium responsible for producing?
What was discovered in short term studies?
In what year was Penicillium discovered?

context: In <a5_0><b13_0>1971<b13_0/><a5_0/>, <a1_0><a6_0><b10_0>Akira Endo<b10_0/><a6_0/><a1_0/>, a Japanese biochemist working for the pharmaceutical company Sankyo, identified mevastatin (ML-236B), a molecule produced by the fungus <a3_0><a7_0><b11_0>Penicillium citrinum<b11_0/><a7_0/><a3_0/>, as an inhibitor of <a8_0>HMG-CoA reductase<a8_0/>, a critical enzyme used by the body to produce <a2_0>cholesterol<a2_0/>. Animal trials showed very good inhibitory effect as in clinical trials, however a long term study in dogs found toxic effects at higher doses and as a result mevastatin was believed to be <a4_0><b12_0>too toxic for human use<b12_0/><a4_0/>. Mevastatin was never marketed, because of its <a0_0><b9_0>adverse effects of tumors, muscle deterioration, and sometimes death<b9_0/><a0_0/> in laboratory dogs.
